Description: Rim and shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos; interior: reserved at rim, glazed black below; on top of rim, incised spoked rosettes with added red on hearts and petals between brown bands; on edge of lip, band of black dots; on wall, black figure decoration consisting of lion and deer to right (of lion head, body, upper part of front legs, tip of tail remain; red on eye, snout, lips, tongue, ear, mane, ribs, chest, legs, underbelly and tail; of deer hindquarters, tail and left hind leg; red on rump); dot and spoked rosettes as filling ornament; three drill holes on interior from sampling for clay analysis.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 287-8, no. B261)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0244) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
